intro: Lappula pavlovii, commonly known as the Pavlov's lappula, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae, which includes many salt-tolerant species. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in sandy or rocky soils. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, and the leaves are usually fleshy and succulent. It is adapted to withstand drought and high salinity, making it a hardy species in harsh climates.
